cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 495 miles E of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow and turn west-southwest on Tuesday, then track west toward the northwestern Bahamas and Florida’s east-central coast before crossing the Florida Peninsula and curving northeast across Georgia/South Carolina late this week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central coast of Florida (near or north of West Palm Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Volusia/Brevard County line FL southward to Hallandale Beach FL, including Lake Okeechobee; Storm Surge Watch from Altamaha Sound GA to Hallandale Beach FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: None (only watches issued as of Advisory #2)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Bahamas and the east coast of Florida, then interior GA/SC and portions of the Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible late Thursday into Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Alabama coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible late Thursday into Friday as remnants move across the Southeast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat stays well east of Mobile with current forecast track.
